title: What is the least abundant natural element? - Quora

response.answer_text: It is probably astatine, At. All of its isotopes are radiactive, with the longest having a half-life of about 8 hours. It occurs as the decay product of other radioactive elements.

Astatine. This element is very unstable and decays in a few hours. It is only existing from decay of other naturel radioactive elements. On average there is always only one gram or less astatine in total on/in our earth.
